runs.comm: starts very un-T20, full length just outside off and left alone
meets it on the full on leg stump, clipped to backward square leg
off stump again, clipped down to long off to get England underway
length just outside off, Hales stayed in his crease and tried to cut, got a bottom edge that he nearly dragged towards his stumps
slog sweep over square leg, taken nicely from middle and off, lofted for four, well struck
and this is even better, opens the face and drives past backward point with good timing for four
back of a length just outside off, went to pull, got it high on the pad and nearly presented a catch towards the bowler's left hand
length, off stump, carefully forward to block towards cover
forward again just outside off, blocking to cover
short and does Kieswetter for pace as he tries to pull and is way too late playing the stroke, misses completely
much fuller and slower, dropped towards mid on and they race through for a single
similar delivery, tucked towards mid on again, this time Steyn fields with his right hand
length just outside off, driven hard but only to point
middle stump line, carefully in behind it towards midwicket
beautiful, a step down the wicket and taking a length ball past extra cover, excellent timing and just gave himself a bit of room
and this swing outside off presents a catch straight to where slip would have been, what are the odds
fuller just outside off, Kieswetter looks to run it to third man and it nips through and beats him
Kieswetter takes another step down and this time picks a leg stump ball up very nicely and it sails all the way for six over wide long on, super strike
cut hard, half-saved by point, two down to third man
this time angled straight to the third man fielder
slower ball, just outside off, a swing and a miss

dropped into the leg side, Hales came a long way down and was sent back, Kallis throws down the stumps and is run out, total waste for England but a good scalp for South Africa and sharp work, excellent work from Kallis, never a run there
angled down to third man from a full ball
back of a length outside off, left alone
forward onto middle and off stumps, defended back to the bowler
back of a length, pulled into the leg side, comes off the gloves to square leg
full ball, a pleasant drive down the ground to long off
full onto the stumps, tucked to leg and Bopara's away
bit of a wild swing towards the leg side, it comes off a wild edge and flies over the empty slip cordon for four, no third man at home, fortunate
tries to go over mid on again, this time half-catches it and it almost carries to Botha, who leapt high in the air with his left hand, got a lot on it but couldn't cling on
back of a length just outside off, pushed to point
full ball just outside off, played forward into the leg side
slower ball just outside off, fiddled at and missed outside off
length ball, clubbed to leg without timing, falls short of mid on and they take a quick single
stump to stump, played forward through square leg for a single
length outside off, flicked cut wide of third man

and the first ball spins into the front pad and is given out lbw. Nice delivery first up, jags back and strikes Kieswetter in line with off stump, pretty plumb in front, Kieswetter played across it but got done by the turn
around the wicket, full ball, played in a controlled manner down to long off
forward and played to the same fielder, who's now long on
lovely shot, opens up the off side with a big stride and flicks it past short extra cover with superb timing
tucked into midwicket now, the deep fielder scrambles in well and saves the second
off stump, worked back to the bowler
length ball, Morgan misses looking to play to leg, leg bye past the slip
back of a length just outside off, pushed through point
waited for in the crease and carved to third man

can you believe it, Bopara gone again caught at slip and it is exactly the same dismissal as Bopara's other dismissals against South Africa, pushing tentatively forward to a fullish ball just outside off without moving his feet and getting an edge behind the wicket
length outside off and left alone
length ball dropped into the covers
down the wicket and tucked into the on side, they consider the second and turn it down
floated up outside off, tucked to mid off
step to leg to give himself a bit of room and it's timed to perfection past extra cover, lovely stroke
step away again, this time pushing to deep point
down the wicket, gets a bit close to it and ends up turning it down to long on
reverse sweep behind deep point so they take two
length ball just outside off, angled down to third man
went to turn it into the on side and got struck on the pad, no run into the covers
full outside off, pushed to cover
slower bouncer, pulled well but straight to long leg, picked out with excellence
full towards the pads, flicks the ankle and runs towards long leg, de Villiers scrambles and saves the second
dropped down to third man, played with delicate soft hands so they can come back for the second
tossed up and spinning across, Morgan misses a hack across the line, down on one knee, but the ball slips past de Villiers for byes
bowled him, Morgan chops on! He tried to manufacture another busy shot, against the turn and it was a bit too close, the ball taking a chunk of bat and cannoning on to the wicket
tossed up and played back to the bowler
bit of bounce, plays on the up and edges low to short third man
flighted, on the stumps, pushed back down the wicket
unfurls the reverse sweep early on, taking a length ball from around off stump through gully
length ball outside off stump, squirted away wide of square man for a couple
touch shorter, turned into the midwicket area
opens the face, steering a length ball from outside off fine, third man gets round to prevent four

on the stumps, angling in, tickled towards long-on and they think about two but Bairstow has to regain his ground at the bowler's end and end up bumping into Kallis and coming off the worse, looking up with a grin at the big man
goes across and closes the face to take a length ball through midwicket
length delivery outside off, pushed into the covers
flighted, on the stump, worked in front of midwicket
dragged down, a touch short, leaves the crease and dabs into the leg side
bowled him, another one gone! Buttler beaten by the flight and turn, well down the wicket and all at sea, he pushed tamely as the ball span by and clattered into middle and off
pushed through on off stump, tapped into the covers
goes back and whips a length ball through the leg side
flighted on the stumps, plays from the crease but can't get it back past the bowler
length ball, coming in and hit on the pad, Morkel appeals but it was probably outside the line
takes a length ball outside off and guides to third man
pitched up wide of the stump, driven through the covers to the sweeper

gone, tries to go big but holes out to long-on! England are making a right horlicks of this, Bairstow trying to up the pace and punching a lofted drive limply to the man stationed out near the boundary
back of a length, on the pads and flicked down to long leg
short of a length and coming back in, beats Patel's push forward and he's hit on the body
round the wicket, straightening outside off, tries to paddles to leg but it doesn't come off
pushed through a bit quicker on off stump, driven nicely off the back foot through the covers for a couple
flighted outside off, spinning away from Broad, hits the shoulder of the bat and pops towards point
tossed up and spinning away, misses with a sweep
full and enticing, gets forward and drives to cover
touch shorter, on the stumps, goes back and mistimes a flick to leg - another tight over for South Africa
floated up outside off stump, driven to long-off
tossed up on off stump, full length, Broad leans out and turns through midwicket

hits out and goes, caught in the deep by the diving Kallis. It was boom or bust and Patel was not going to be bailed out, trying to hoick over long-off, didn't get enough bat on it and Kallis ran in to dive full length, sliding along the turf and getting safely under a magnificent catch
pushed through on the stumps and played back to the bowler
flicked off the legs through square leg
looped up outside off stump, punched to extra-cover coming forward
length ball, shaping back in towards the top of off, driven on the back foot through cover
pacy ball in the corridor outside off, Swann plays and misses
back of a length, at the batsman, who tries to hook and gets it all sorts of wrong, wearing the ball on the arm/chest
bumper, wide of the stumps, steps away and flails at the ball, tapping unsuccessfully into ground towards point
pitched up a bit more, clears the front leg and swipes to mid-off, this time they take a single
fullish length ball, on off stump, chopped into the leg side
tossed up outside off, pushed out towards long-off and they get back for a second
played off the back foot to mid-on
flighted, outside the line of off, Swann leans out and heaves through midwicket, there's a man on the rope but he won't get round and that's the first boundary since the ninth over
wide of the stumps, gets forward and slaps through the covers
tossed up on the stumps and he doesn't connect with a flick to leg
shorter length, goes back and carves the ball over the bowler's head, straight down the ground for another four
Swann, the merry slogger, steps away and launches the ball over extra-cover, between two fielders in the deep and that's four more
shorter length, gets across the stumps and flicks over square leg
full and wide of the stumps, flayed through the covers on the full to the sweeper
full length and straight, Swann steps away and cracks the back back down the pitch to long-on
full of a length, angled across outside off, driven into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket
full and wide of the stumps, Broad dabs at it and misses, okay by the umpire though
back of a length outside off stump, Swann wanders across and flamboyantly flicks over backward square leg, that runs away for another four
full and wide of the wicket this time, Swann clumps his bat down and manages to squeeze one through point
fearsome bouncer from Steyn, right at Broad's bonce as he backed away to leg, he's left on his backside as it whistles through
full and straight now, Broad keeps his head and punches through the covers for one into the deep
pitched up outside off and Swann can't get under it, hacks low through cover
slower ball this time, just outside leg stump and Broad steps back, fails to connect, de Villiers collects but they squeak through for a final bye
